section.title: About scheduled reports

listitem.para: A scheduled report is based on existing dashboards with charts, maps or tables. You create the report and the schedule in the Maintenance app.

When you run a scheduled report job, the system compiles a list of recipients from the user groups you've selected. The system then generates a report for each member of the selected user groups. Each of the dashboard items are generated specifically for each user .
This means that the data reflects the data the user has access to (or if the "user org unit" and similar options are set in the chart/map/reportTable, the users org unit is used).
All users could therefore get the same report (if all the data is "static") or custom reports (if all the data is "dynamic"), or a combination of the two.

The reports are sent by e-mail, not through the internal DHIS2 messaging system. If a user doesn't have a valid e-mail, or if the job fails, no e-mails are sent. In this case, the problem is also logged on the server.

The title and message parameters you set up in the Maintenance app, are added to each report. The name you give the report is not included in the report e-mail. Instead, the name is used to identify the push analysis object in the system. This way a report can be named one thing, and the title of the report can be another.

note.para: The data generated in the reports is public so verify that you don't include any sensitive data.

section.title: Create an automatic report/ push analysis/a push report

listitem.para: Open the Maintenance app and click Other > Push analysis.
Click the add button.
In the Name field, type the name of the push report.
This name is not included in the report e-mail. Instead, the name is used to identify the push analysis object in the system.
(Optional) In the Code field, assign a code.
Add a report Title.
This title is included in the report e-mail.
(Optional) Add a Message.
This message is included in the report e-mail.
Select a Dashboard to base the report on.
Select and assign the user groups you want to send the report to.
Select a Scheduling frequency: Daily, Weekly or Monthly.

note.para: If you schedule a push report to "Monthly" and "31", the job will not run if the month has less than 31 days.

listitem.para: (Optional) Select Enable to activate the push report.
The push report job won't run until you activate it.
(Optional) Click Run to run the push report job immediately.
Click Save.
